images.copyright: A great egret in Everglades National Park, Florida (© Troy Harrison/Getty Images)
images.title: Stretching out in the Everglades
images.caption: Everglades National Park turns 75
images.desc: We're heading down to Florida today to celebrate the 75th year of Everglades National Park, the largest tropical wilderness in the United States. The park was established in 1947 to defend a fragile ecosystem and covers about 20% of the entire Everglades wetland. But even with the park service's protection, the Everglades' features, primarily shallow freshwater pools, have suffered significantly due to human activity.
